H0.text: Air temperature is the information that could be collected to best illustrate the noticeable patterns of seasonal change in New England.

H1.text: Wind speed is the information that best illustrates the noticeable seasonal changes observed in New England.

H2.text: Amount of precipitation is the best information to collect to illustrate seasonal changes in New England.

H3.text: Number of cloudy days is the information that can best illustrate the noticeable patterns of seasonal change in New England.

A4.text: Annual rainfall is typically spread evenly throughout the year, although droughts have historically been most common during the summer months.

A5.text: In this region, summers can be quite long and hot, with humid, tropical air masses common between May and September.

A6.text: In Campinas, the daily temperature range in July (the coolest month of the year) may typically vary between 10 and 24 째C (range of 14 째C), while in January, it may range between 20 and 30 째C (range of 10 째C).
